headline: Creole Hot Water Cornbread
name: Creole Hot Water Cornbread
description: These crispy little cornmeal patties are fried and served warm, drizzled with honey, maple syrup or honey butter. It's a very simple recipe.

recipeInstructions.text: Combine the cornmeal, Creole seasoning, onion, and sugar in a medium bowl. Pour in boiling water and shortening; stir until the shortening melts.

Melt lard or bacon fat to a depth of 1/2 inch in a large skillet; bring to a temperature of 375 degrees F (190 degrees C) over medium-high heat. Shape heaping tablespoons of the dough into flattened balls (thickness is a personal preference). Fry in hot oil, turning once, until crisp and golden brown, about 5 minutes. Drain on paper towels.
